CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 1, 1958, pg. 1, reads: "Discrimination is Unlawful - Alderman Harris B. Fitzgerald (sitting, extreme right) impressed bartender William Wall (left to right) and John Whalen, owner of Chick's Grill in McKees Rocks, that refusal to serve customers because of race is unlawful. The charges had been filed by bearded Fred Rogers and his friend,  John Davis (standing, extreme right). Wall and Whalen paid over $20 in costs.  THe other person in picture is Constable Fred Terry. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Alderman Harry B. Fitzgerald, hearing racial discrimination case against Chick's Grill bartenders William Wall and John Walen on left, brought by Fred Rogers wearing beard, and John Davis standing on right, with Constable Fred Terry on right
